image.altText: A woman leans on a fence on a rural property.

props.synopsis: Janet Ainscow lives next door to the stable of Tasmania's leading harness racing trainer. She's been speaking out about allegations of team driving at race meets, and the conditions horses are being kept in. It's taken years, but she now feels vindicated.

title.children: Horse trainer Ben Yole's neighbour blew the whistle on him. She finally feels 'vindicated'

image.altText: Timothy King

props.synopsis: We ask people for their experiences of Tasmania's ailing health system and hear of misdiagnoses, long waits for treatment or, worse still, no treatment at all. But we also receive some good reports.

title.children: 'I said X-ray and she said no': The stories you told us about Tasmania's healthcare system

image.altText: Deepinderjeet 'Deep' Singh sits at a table.

props.synopsis: Friends come together to pay respects to a man who drowned after allegedly being pushed into the river at Hobart's waterfront during a robbery.

title.children: Friends remember 'kind-hearted' uni student who drowned during alleged robbery on Hobart's waterfront

image.altText: group of lifeguards, most with faces blurred

props.synopsis: ABC investigation tracks former Sunshine Coast teacher and coach Dean Carelse to a family holiday park in south-west England.

title.children: UK family fun park employs Queensland paedophile and former water polo coach as children’s lifeguard

image.altText: The back of a van, with a decal on it that reads Post Office

props.synopsis: When British post offices introduced a new accounting system more than two decades ago, money started going missing — what happened next has been described by some as the country's biggest ever miscarriage of justice.

title.children: 'They were like the mafia': When money went missing from post offices, everyone was looking in the wrong place

image.altText: housing estate shot from a drone

props.synopsis: House prices are on track to rise across the country, propelled by renters and migrants wanting to buy their own homes and buyers trying to get in ahead of interest rate cuts expected later this year.

title.children: The gap between house and unit prices has reached a record high, as values keep climbing

image.altText: A composite image shows Georgie Purcell in two photos which appear identical except for changes to her clothing.

props.synopsis: A graphics expert says Nine News's explanation for how a digitally altered photo of Victorian Animal Rights Party MP Georgie Purcell was put to air is plausible — and raises important questions over the way the technology is used across society.

title.children: We took a closer look at Nine's explanation for its altered image of Georgie Purcell. Here's what we found

image.altText: A man in an orange tie and a black and white suit stands at a podium.

props.synopsis: After unveiling his re-jigged tax plan last week, Anthony Albanese has conducted five press conferences, eight radio interviews and two TV interviews — the kind of media blitz usually reserved for winning an election, writes David Speers.

title.children: Albanese goes all in on Labor's rejigged tax cuts, while cracks form in the Coalition

image.altText: Close up shot of a hand holding a pencil above a receipt, with notebook and calculator also in shot

props.synopsis: The opposition is adamant the government's changes to stage 3 tax cuts expose Australians to bracket creep, now and into the future. So how much of an issue is bracket creep and will these changes set back the cause for addressing it?

title.children: Why are people saying the Stage 3 tax cut changes will worsen bracket creep?

image.altText: Two women embrace outside a burnt building.

props.synopsis: Many Israelis say that they will never forgive Palestinians for what Hamas did. It's this "never forgiving" that puts the two sides further apart than ever in this decades-old conflict, writes John Lyons.

title.children: Jump on a plane to Israel and you'll see one of the enduring ways life has changed since October 7

image.altText: A young boy in a blue soccer jersey kicks a soccer ball while being pursued by other children

props.synopsis: New guidelines have been released giving parents and sporting groups clarity over how to deal with concussion in junior and community sport.

title.children: New guidelines urge concussed athletes to wait three weeks before returning to competitive sport

image.altText: Close-up of a green Medicare card with a calculator and money in the background

props.synopsis: Disadvantaged areas have recorded among the highest increase in bulk-billed GP appointments since the government tripled the Medicare incentive in November, but for those who don’t qualify the cost remains a significant barrier.

title.children: Bulk billing decline reverses in first months of tripled GP incentive

image.altText: Sun shines through trees from above

props.synopsis: A council plan to protect Perth's trees will be rejected by WA Planning Minister John Carey despite overwhelming community support, the ABC understands.

title.children: Plan to save tree canopy in Australia's least leafy city poised to be cut down by planning minister

image.altText: The entrance to a large building.

props.synopsis: The hospital informs Ms O'Neill and apologises after it discovers a photo of her injured, unbandaged leg had been shared publicly, in a serious breach of patient privacy.

title.children: St Vincent's Hospital apologises to woman bitten by shark in Sydney Harbour after photo leaked

image.altText: A young woman and a young man stand with arms oustretched in front of a small

props.synopsis: We wanted to own our own home without getting too far into debt, so we built a modest one-bedroom home on a block of land in regional Tasmania, with plans to extend it in the future.

title.children: How a young couple built the modest one-bedroom home they could afford

image.altText: A blurred person in the back of a police paddywagon in Queensland

props.synopsis: Taskforce Guardian has arrested hundreds of repeat offenders since it was created, but is it actually solving youth crime?

title.children: Millions have been spent on this youth crime taskforce. Is it working?

image.altText: Green Day's Mike Dirnt, Billie Joe Armstrong and Tre Cool walk down a New York City street

props.synopsis: Their DIY punk scene back home disowned them but Dookie made Green Day the biggest band on the planet.

title.children: How Dookie made Green Day the biggest (and most hated) punk band on earth

image.altText: A close up of a middle-aged white man standing outside near the open boot of a car in a puffer vest.

props.synopsis: The actor pleads not guilty over the shooting death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins during filming of the western Rust.

title.children: Alec Baldwin pleads not guilty to fatal shooting on movie set

image.altText: Sheep seen through the open vents of a ship

props.synopsis: A livestock vessel stuck off the coast of Perth for several days after a failed journey to the Middle East berths at Fremantle Port, with some animals set to be removed from the MV Bahijah this morning.

title.children: Live export ship berths in Fremantle to offload sheep and cattle after ending up stuck off coast

image.altText: Celeste Manno.

props.synopsis: As Victoria's Supreme Court prepares to sentence obsessed killer Luay Sako, experts say stalking remains an "epidemic" that authorities are struggling to contain.

title.children: As a court prepares to sentence Celeste Manno's obsessive killer, experts say there are many more just like him

image.altText: Israeli drone in Gaza

props.synopsis: Approvals to export Australian made military equipment to Israel are being "stalled" by the Albanese government as concerns grow over the rising number of civilian casualties in Gaza.

title.children: Australia 'stalls' military export requests from Israel over Gaza war concerns, growing number of civilian casualties

image.altText: Woman holds child son and looks at him lovingly

props.synopsis: Hayley Battisson put Nate's name down on waiting lists at nearly every speech pathology practice in Rockhampton years ago. She fears a dire shortage of regional clinicians has put him at a disadvantage.

title.children: Nate has waited nearly two years for speech therapy. It took a desperate plea on TikTok to get him help

image.altText: A collection of old photos of people celebrating Lotto wins.

props.synopsis: Australians are readying for the country's biggest-ever lotto jackpot, but the astronomical odds of winning have prompted experts to issue warnings to people dreaming of striking it rich.

title.children: Expert says you're 'far more likely' to die today than win Australia's largest ever lotto jackpot

image.altText: Moment Kathleen Folbigg acquitted of killing her children

props.synopsis: Chief Justice Andrew Bell says "overstretched" judges and magistrates face  increasing pressure and stress.

title.children: NSW's highest-ranking judge says current caseloads are 'simply unsustainable'

image.altText: A woman bowls during a T20 match

props.synopsis: Australia bowler Lauren Cheatle will miss out on a Women's Premier League (WPL) debut after having a skin cancer taken out of her neck.

title.children: Lauren Cheatle out of Women's Premier League after having skin cancer removed

image.altText: Richarlison celebrates

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou's Spurs are back in the  Premier League's top four after beating Brentford in a five-goal thriller.

title.children: Postecoglou's bold half-time changes pay off as Spurs come back to win thriller

image.altText: A man smiles with short brown hair wears a green and gold jersey, he sits in front of computer with map open

props.synopsis: For the next seven months, Oscar Pearce is hoping to spend about eight hours per day guessing where he is in the world, but from his computer.

title.children: Adelaide man takes exploring the world to the next level using Google Street View clues

image.altText: The back of a mans head standing in front of a crowd of people holding up placards of pictures

props.synopsis: The CEO of Meta expressed regret and pledged to work to prevent further harm as five tech bosses were grilled at a US Senate child safety hearing.

title.children: Zuckerberg forced to apologise to parents of children harmed on Facebook and Instagram

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A fall on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks lower, as the US Federal Reserve holds interest rates steady at a 23-year high. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX pulls back from record high as Wall Street dips after US Fed holds rates steady

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Business confidence falls as effects of rate rises 'increasingly evident'
When will the RBA cut interest rates?

image.altText: Women sitting stares toward into distance, with trees and building in background.

props.synopsis: Survivors of institutional childhood sexual abuse have launched a class action against one of Australia's most prominent sexual abuse law firms, which they say failed to obtain proper compensation from the institutions responsible for their abuse.

title.children: Sexual abuse survivors turn on their lawyers, alleging negligence in class action lawsuit

image.altText: A firefighter surrounded by burning trees,

props.synopsis: Traditional fire management strategies such as hazard reduction burns, logging, and the thinning of undergrowth have increased the flammability of forests, new research has found.

title.children: Hazard reduction burns increase risk of severe bushfires, report finds

image.altText: Two teenage girls in school uniform standing in a bushy area.

props.synopsis: Murrumbidgee Regional High School was formed in 2019 and by many accounts did little but cause hassles and intensify rivalries between students.

title.children: Parents and students cheer as 'super school' demerges after 'nightmare' five years

image.altText: A storm is viewed off a coastal pathway

props.synopsis: Look back on the month that was in this series of fascinating photos from ABC journalists and contributors across Western Australia.

title.children: Freak weather, solemn moments and impressive feats: WA's January 2024 in photos
